deck_excerpt: Some nice rogue deck, able to compete with meta.
deck_description: Vanilla antimeta. The deck relies on Pacifis, the Phantasm City to maintain field presence with Tokens and disruption with Phantasm Spiral Battle. Some additions are Sea Stealth Attack, which protects your face-up Spells and Traps and punishes the opponent every time your Tokens battle, allowing them to destroy almost any threat your opponent has. Also Gozen Match is extremely powerful vs. decks that utilize more than 1 attribute. Scapegoat is your gateway to access Link Summons, while the Solemn Traps, Skill Drain and Macro Cosmos provide disruption and powerful floodgates. Metaverse ensures that you maintain your field spells active and also serves to disrupt Graveyard-reliant decks by activating Necrovalley directly from the Deck.

deck_excerpt: All about hand traps.dek
deck_description:
This deck showcases a control strategy, with the PSY-Framegears disrupting the opponent's actions heavily, PSY-Frame Overload banishing the opponent's cards and the PSY-Frame Synchro monsters disrupting the opponent's hand and field actions.

Foolish Burial Goods is there to send Overload to the Graveyard, turning it into an easy search on the next turn. Artifact Lancea was my tech choice as it protects your Gears and Drivers if you do not control Circuit or have a free monster zone for your Synchro Summons. Beatrice and Big Eye were chose over other Xyz because of their great synergy with PSY-Frames, Beatrice for enabling Multi-Threader and Overload plays and Big Eye for stealing the opposing monsters as a last resort. Overall, this is a good rogue deck, capable of facing most strategies and unleashing very powerful options, such as PSY-Framelord Omega and Crystal Wing Synchro Dragon to opress the opponent.

deck_excerpt: OTK based fluffal deck with losts of resiliance for simple negating effects.
A deck I created after researching Xyz's and the anime Yu-Gi-Oh Zexal series. It's inspired by the Chaos Xyzs, Utopias and 100+ Numbers that were feat
deck_description:
This is a zexal-inspired deck that works around summoning Xyz's (non-link format, so you can't spam anymore) with the purpose of bringing out their CXyz (Chaos Xyz form). As it's namesake might suggest, the boss monster - and goal - is to bring about CXyz Barian Hope. The best way to bring about Barian Hope would be to use C101: Silent Honor Dark - which has an effect that allows you to pile on more Overlay material for Barian Hope, which boosts Hope's ATK/DEF. This can lead to an OTK, as it's not difficult to reach a 5000/5000 or 6000/6000 beater with CXyz Barian Hope. Aside from the boss monster, the deck revolves around the Utopia Chaos series - enabling you to deal damage or prevent damage, depending on the situation; and given other situations, there are various Xyzs - Castel (clearing), Honor Ark (card destruction + clearing), etc.

Basics: Most of the spells exist, in the counts that they are in, to speed up the summoning of a Chaos Xyz - but there are some reinforcement cards in spells like Xyz Territory and Xyz Tribal Rivals (the latter of which can make a nearly indestructible board). The Monsters exist, too, in their current number for the purpose of summoning an Xyz in a turn or two.

deck_excerpt: This metaphys deck focuses more on storming the field and otk. Naturally the extra deck focuses more on xyz and link.
deck_description:
Grinder Golem Combo:
  1. summon grinder golem
  2. summon 2 linkuriboh
  3. summon Akashic Magician
  4. summon grinder golem
  5. summon security dragon, activate effect
  6. summon grinder golem
  7. summon firewall dragon using akashic and two grinder golem tokens
  8. use firewall dragon effect and return grinder golem to the hand
  9. special summon grinder golem
  10. use a token and the security dragon to special summon security dragon
  11. firewall dragon effect special summons something from your hand
  12. special summon grinder golem into a area the firewall dragon is pointing to
  13. special summon proxy dragon using two tokens
  14. special summon linkuriboh from the grave using a token
  15. attack
  16. main phase two use linkuriboh, proxy dragon, security dragon, and the monster special summoned from your hand to build borreload or skull dread
OR from step 9 10. use a token and the security dragon to summon Ib the World Chalice Priestess 11. special summon Linkuriboh from the grave   figure out the rest by yourself, this is a fairly easy deck.

deck_excerpt: Rokkets are the cybernetic dragons used by Yu-Gi-Oh! VRAINS's Revolver to power his signature monster, the Link-4 behemoth, Borreload Dragon.
deck_description: The main strategy here is to Link Summon as soon as possible to get out your roadblocker,Â Linkbelt Wall Dragon This guy makes it so your opponent has to get a strong enough Link monster out on the field, but, with the added effect that you can only Link Summon up to the amount of Counters on Linkbelt, if you can manage to get the counters to 0, no Link Summoning, now this is a double-edged sword, so be careful not to impale yourself on it The Rokkets' main purpose, in this deck, are to get in your opponent's way, Anesthrokket Dragon is the card you'll want the most with it's DEF of 2200, boostable to 2500 with their Field Spell, Revolve Boot Sector, which has a sort of reverse-Evenly Matched effect, if your opponent controls more monsters than you, you can summon Rokkets from your GY in Defense Position up to the surplus You can also, during your turn, Special Summon up to 2 Rokket monsters from hand in Defense Position, if you already have monster's on the field, this more often than let's you go straight into Borreload, which sets up a whole load of different combos with the Rokkets, they all have different effects which let you take care of cards your opponent has that's annoying you, Shelrokket DragonÂ let's you also destroy monsters in adjacent zones This deck can already do a hell of a lot, and until it becomes Meta-Relavant, it's just going to keep getting better and better with every new card that comes out for them.

deck_excerpt: This deck is the one i used
This is certainly not a competitive or meta deck but if you'd like to relive the era of Nekroz you can give this deck a try.
deck_description: The strategy is similar to Nekroz with the exception of the cards that it uses as ritual summoning fodder. Most of the fodder does come from the regular deck, but there is generally not enough fodder in any given hand for you to summon Trishula; the boss of this deck and the hardest card to summon. Whilst this deck does not perform the special summons of a true Nekroz deck and can not survive off of the extra deck in a link format, it does have its strengths: being able to turn weak, but sustainable, card advantage into plus summons and being able to protect monsters that are on the field for extended periods of time.

deck_excerpt: True Draco Engine + Synchros (weaker search engine, burns fast, strong beatdown potential, extra-deck spam capacity is there)
deck_description:
Strategy:

  • Objective: Summon Metaltron XII, the True Dracombatant by means of 3 tributes
    • Let opponent trigger Metaltron eff. or keep the 3000/3000 beater (if you have dragonic --> 3.3k/3.3k beater)
This deck relies on the True Draco engine, though it can not pull of the card advantage that was once typical of True Draco. The engine is not used in this deck to establish card advantage, though it can be useful for this purpose, but to bring out Metaltron. Metaltron can be brought out in 2 ways.
  • 1.) Tribute Summon - requires 3 (3 spells, 0 monsters | 2 spells, 1 monster | 1 spell, 2 monsters | 0 spells, 3 monsters)
    • This is ideal as it allows you to trigger Metaltron's eff - which can be used to delve into the synchro portion of the extra deck as needed
  • 2.) Dreiath III, the True Dracocavalry General: this card's eff is upon being sent to the graveyard (you can tribute this card for another True Draco or for metaltron itself - and bring out another metaltron, etc.) it allows you to summon any True Draco monster - which includes Metaltron (though this negates the eff of Metaltron and should only be used if you need a defensive card or a beater).
Aside from bringing out Metaltron, details above, the deck focuses on gradual spell advantage through the True Draco spell system - which can not be searched due to the limitation of Ignis and ban of Dinomight Knight. The spell system works in that traps are used to destroy opponent's monsters - and bring out True Draco monsters - and spells are used in one of two ways. True Draco Heritage allows you to draw and is the most basic card when it comes to spell advantage, it should always be set before a spell/trap tribute summon of a true draco spell/trap --> gives you a +1 card advantage. The second spell is Disciples of the True Dracopheonix which can serve as fodder in the beginning of a duel but must be kept around for later in a duel so that the True Draco engine can be kept alive; as this card allows you to recycle cards such as Dreiath and Metaltron - which are key to bringing out Metaltron and the Sycnhros associated with his eff. Other Important Cards:
  • Masterpeace: Same use as in previous True Draco decks, though this is not necessarily the boss "monster" of the deck anymore. Masterpeace serves as a card that can shut down and/or prevent chains - as well as give you ridiculous card advantage. I keep 2 but if you prefer Master Peace to Metaltron, use Â 3.
  • Ash Blossom...: Standard hand trap, multi-purpose and won't trigger graveyard effs (though you can replace Ash with Ghost Ogre & Snow Rabbit if you'd prefer sending to graveyard)
  • Dragonic Diagram: Allows you to search for true draco spells/traps/monsters --> Key to speeding up the engine and securing Metaltron through 3 tributes. Not the most important card in the deck but it acts as the primary searcher, allowing you to trigger spell/trap effects and bring more into your hand.
    • Ideal combos: Dragonic Diagram (activation) --> tribute of fodder card (useless card) or Dreiath --> Summon Metaltron or Ignis from Dreiath eff --> obtain something like True Draco Heritage or Dracopheonix from sacrifice (whatever is more appropriate for the situation) --> Use to gain card advantage --> beatdown + spell/trap destruction --> repeat
  • Extra Deck Synchros: Many are situational but some can be used in any battle as a boss monster that can guarantee victory. Personally I'd bring out Crystal Wing Synchro Dragon for it's effect but Barbaroid has one of the most brutal effects available to you and can help beef up a deck that is otherwise lacking in immediate offensive firepower.
Not really sure what else to say here, so I'll leave it at that. If you have any tips, I guess you can contact me on here?

deck_description: This is a fun little casual deck I made that mainly revolves around the virus cards with a Dark Magician theme to it. The main focus of the deck is using the main virus cards (Deck Devastation Virus, Eradicator Epidemic Virus, Full Force Virus and Crush Card Virus) to stall and cripple your opponents strategy. And although it's not fantastic due to how much resources it requires, I've also included a small Doom Virus Dragon engine. The rest of the cards are the usual Dark Magician engine type cards. Secret Sanctuary of the Spellcasters and Secret Village of the Spellcasters being the ultimate stall combo (remember you need a Spellcaster on the field!).

deck_excerpt: brokenfoes
deck_description:
This deck is not for link (for those who play pendulum era only) if you have any questions about this deck you can contact me on discord: StealthAngel#2555   Older versions of this deck: 30 march: http://www.mediafire.com/file/9a566itxr09acjj/16101.ydk 2 oct 2020: https://www.mediafire.com/file/ufjq3eb36roo152/16101%25282%2529.ydk way before: http://www.mediafire.com/file/6bjnee1bsih76nb/A%20Brokenfoes%20v0.46%20%28Mo_D_Genesis%29.ydk

Summary

This deck depends on your metalfoes skill. If you can play metalfoes this deck will work greatly in your favor. I won't be covering the metalfoes basics since there is enough information on the internet out there. I might make a video in the future on how to make plays with this deck. It will be posted here. You can learn to play metalfoes by practicing. A good beginner idea is to destroy all your metalfoe cards and end up with a pendulum scale 1 - 8 so you can summon your monsters back.

Why do we run 46 cards as opposed to 40 cards?

This deck has good drawing power. If you are going to utilize your side deck, you can still utilize your main cards without needing to sacrifice good cards you need. Wind bitches = 6. Assuming that you get your wind witch combo right ur left with 43 cards in your deck. If you remove wind witches you have 41 cards. Whats wrong with 41 cards :)  

strengths

  • High piercing damage on defence monsters
  • great summoning power
  • great recovery
  • Great Defence ability.
  • ability to steal opponents monsters
  • nice field of monsters and facedown cards
  • draw power
  • awesome side deck
  • glorious extra deck if used well

weaknesses

  • solemn strike (don't over summon if you think your opponent has it don't summon all your monsters have some just in case)
  • evenly matched (wtf is this card)
  • relies on special summoning
  • with endless nightmare you are fucked unless you can do something about it
  • you will have issues with untargetable monsters or monsters such as Crystal Wing Synchro Dragon (the solution for this is number s39 or you use metalfoes orichalc and metalfoes mithrilium)
  • weak if your card are getting banished
  • not the best backrow destroyer such as spells and traps (you might place some twin twisters in this deck if that is a problem)

Monsters

Metalfoes Mithrilium

If this card is used right it is one of the best cards. You can shuffle your opponent cards to their hand but also your own cards. kaijus can be brought back to your hand. The best idea with mithrilium is sending one of your own metalfoes monster on the field to your hand so that you have the missing pendulum scale in for summoning pendulums. Shuffle nopes to your opponents hand. Shuffle cards you need back to your own hand. Also if this card is destroyed you can recover 1 metalfoe normal monster from your graveyard or pendulum zone. Overal great defence.

Metalfoes orichalc

If you need to quickly destroy a card on the field, you can destroy with your pendulum zone this card to destroy one card on the field. Also this baby is your main piercing damage amplifier. Also with metalfoes combination you can fusion summon mithrilium with a pendulum monster for orichalc and they will all come back on the field.

Metalfoes alkahest

Steal his monster if needed.

Kaijus (tributing their monsters optional)

You have a choice between:
  • Lava Golem
  • The Winged Dragon of Ra - Sphere Mode
  • Kumongous, the Sticky String Kaiju
Those three are your main to go kaijus for this deck. The reason kaijus work with this deck is that you can bring them back to your hand withÂ Metalfoes Mithrilium.Â Sphere also works but it requires 3 tributes although sphere can be a game changing moment, lava golem will almost certainly guarantee that you remove 2 monsters on the field. Use whatever of those 3 monsters you like. Two kaijus in your deck is more than enough. The usefull thing aboutÂ Kumongous, the Sticky String Kaiju is that you can pendulum summon it, and tributing your opponents monster requires no normal summon.

Rescue Rabbit

you get to summon 2 metalfoes. This card is a must have in this deck.

Astrograph Sorcerer

Some people prefer usingÂ Â Majespecter Raccoon - Bunbuku But astrograph gives you more utility. If a card is destroyed you can summon it and you can bring one metalfoe monster from your deck to your hand. It also helps you with summoning numberÂ Number 11: Big Eye This card also has a pendulum scale 1 so it balances it out with Raremetalfoes Bismugear

Archfiend Eccentrick

This card is great because it can destroy a spell card or a monster card. Some people prefer having 3 of them in your deck. However, having 3 of those cards in your extra deck is meaningless since you will be summoning metalfoes most of the times. 2 of them is more than enough. Also you can use archfiend eccentrick onÂ Metalfoes CombinationÂ Â to get another metalfoe in your hand.

Luster Pendulum, the Dracoslayer

This card is next level with metalfoes. with 1 metalfoe monster and luster pendulum you can get another metalfoe to your hand.

Wind bitches

Free Crystal Wing Synchro Dragon? And with pendulum summon you can get a clear wing fast dragon as bonus? Get your hands on it. If you, however don't like them, you can remove them from the deck. If your opponent gives you a hard time doing the wind witch combo, then u can always replace them with your side deck cards. The wind witches are inside to give you more options. The only downside is that you can only summon wind monsters the turn you activate it. Play wisely. On a side note: withÂ Windwitch - Glass Bell and a metalfoe monster you can summon clear wing fast dragon. If you also have Windwitch - Snow Bell then u can get Crystal Wing Synchro DragonÂ regardless.

Spells

Swords of Concealing Light (optional as opposed to quacking mirror force)

The reasonÂ for this card as opposed to a mirror force is that you can get this card back in your hand withÂ Metalfoes Mithrilium

Also they are on defence position on your turn so with metalfoes orichalc you can get dem piercing damage on their faces :)

Supply Squad

since metalfoes are basically destroying their own monsters with card effects, supply squad works for having great draw power. 2 is enough because you don't want 3 of those in your hands or on the field.

Painful Decision

This is your card for getting a metalfoe from your deck. Since you can only use 1 per turn I won't recommend 2 of those in your deck.   Plays
